sponsor: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products R&D, Inc.
briefTitle: A Chronic-Dose Safety and Efficacy Study of Albuterol Multi-Dose Dry Powder Inhaler in Pediatric Asthmatics
officialTitle: A Three-Week, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Chronic-Dose Safety and Efficacy Study of Albuterol Multi-Dose Dry Powder Inhaler (MDPI) Relative to Placebo in Pediatric Asthmatics
summary: The study is to evaluate the chronic-dose efficacy and the safety of Albuterol MDPI compared to placebo in pediatric participants with asthma.

primaryOutcome.measure: Baseline Adjusted Percent Predicted Forced Expiratory Volume In 1 Second (FEV1) Area Under The Concentration Time Curve Up From Time Zero up to 6 Hours (AUC0-6) Over 3 Weeks
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 30 ±5 and 5 ±2 minutes prior to dosing, and at 5 ±2, 15 ±5, 30 ±5, 45 ±5, 60 ±10, 120 ±10, 240 ±10, and 360 ±10 minutes after completion of dosing on Days 1 and 22
